definition: elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent

sentences.english: Man, you have been walking on air for days.
sentences.chinese: 伙计，你最近这几天都一副飘飘然的样子。

sentences.english: I think he's secretly revelling in all the attention.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他对于能够引起广泛的注意心里感到飘飘然。

sentences.english: Says Mr. Goldsmith: 'Strong leaders don't coast.'
sentences.chinese: 戈德史密斯说，强有力的领导人不会飘飘然。

sentences.english: The girl's head turned with a handful of compliments.
sentences.chinese: 几句恭维话让这个女孩飘飘然。

sentences.english: One day I heard my teacher praising me to my mother.
sentences.chinese: 有一天我听见老师向我妈妈表扬我，感觉飘飘然。

sentences.english: I had nothing to eat for two days; I floated into work.
sentences.chinese: 接连两天我什么都没吃，飘飘然去上工。

sentences.english: He just breezed in and sat down, without even apologizing.
sentences.chinese: 他飘飘然地走进来坐下，连道歉都不说一声。

definition: to get carried away/to forget oneself
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
to feel ashamed of one's inferiority (idiom)/to feel inferior
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
the sky spins, the earth goes round (idiom); giddy with one's head spinning/fig. huge changes in the world
